children.description: Specify the content of your Button

className.description: Specify an optional className to be added to your Button

disabled.description: Specify whether the Button should be disabled, or not

dangerDescription.description: Specify the message read by screen readers for the danger button variant

href.description: Optionally specify an href for your Button to become an `<a>` element

isSelected.description: Specify whether the Button is currently selected

kind.description: Specify the kind of Button you want to create

role.description: Optional prop to specify the role of the Button

size.description:
Specify the size of the button, from a list of available sizes.
For `default` buttons, this prop can remain unspecified.

tooltipAlignment.description:
Specify the alignment of the tooltip to the icon-only button.
Can be one of: start, center, or end.

tooltipPosition.description:
Specify the direction of the tooltip for icon-only buttons.
Can be either top, right, bottom, or left.

type.description: Optional prop to specify the type of the Button

n_clicks.description: Number of times this button has been clicked

id.description:
The ID of this component, used to identify dash components
in callbacks. The ID needs to be unique across all of the
components in an app.

info.description: Additional information about the content of this card.

actions.description: Actions available on the side menu, button clicks will be outputted to the actionPropName prop of this card

id.description: Provide an `id` to uniquely identify the Checkbox input

label.description:
Provide a label to provide a description of the Checkbox input that you are
exposing to the user

hideLabel.description: Specify whether the label should be hidden, or not

disabled.description: Specify whether the Checkbox should be disabled

value.description: Specify whether the underlying input is checked

title.description: Specify a title for the <label> node for the Checkbox

className.description: Specify an optional className to be applied to the <label> node

id.description:
The ID of this component, used to identify dash components
in callbacks. The ID needs to be unique across all of the
components in an app.

columnSizes.description: The size of the column with the display size, sm-4, lg-16 ...

offsetSizes.description: The size of the offset with the display size, lg-2 ...

allowInput.description:
flatpickr prop passthrough. Allows the user to enter a date directly
into the input field

id.description:
The ID of this component, used to identify dash components
in callbacks. The ID needs to be unique across all of the
components in an app.

light.description: True to use the light version.

locale.description:
The language locale used to format the days of the week, months, and numbers.
The full list of supported locales can be found here https://github.com/flatpickr/flatpickr/tree/master/src/l10n

maxDate.description: The maximum date that a user can pick to.

minDate.description: The minimum date that a user can start picking from.

short.description: True to use the short version.

value.description: The value of the date value provided to flatpickr

src/lib/components/DatePickerRange.js.description: DatePickerRange, the id of the DateInputs will be id + '-start' and id + '-end'

components in an app.

className.description: Provide a custom className to be applied to the containing `<a>` node

disabled.description: Specify if the control should be disabled, or not

inline.description: Specify whether you want the inline version of this control

size.description: Specify the size of the Link. Currently supports either `sm`, 'md' (default) or 'lg` as an option.

n_clicks.description: Number of times this link has been clicked

visited.description: Specify whether you want the link to receive visited styles after the link has been clicked

href.description: Provide the `href` attribute for the `<a>` node

children.description: Provide the content for the Link

locale.description:
Specify the locale of the control.
Used for the default compareItems used for sorting the list of items in the control.

light.description: true to use the light version.

selectionFeedback.description:
Specify feedback (mode) of the selection.
top: selected item jumps to top
fixed: selected item stays at it's position
top-after-reopen: selected item jump to top after reopen dropdown
default top-after-reopen

direction.description:
Specify the direction of the multiselect dropdown. Can be either top or bottom.
default bottom

invalidText.description: The text to show if it is invalid.

label.description: Generic label that will be used as the textual representation of what this field is for

size.description: Specify the size of the ListBox. Currently supports either sm, lg or xl as an option.

value.description: The list of the selected items

filterable.description: Specify if this component should be filterable

label.description: Provide the contents of your Tab

Specify the text to be read by screen-readers when visiting the <Tabs>
component

children.description:
Pass in a collection of <Tab> children to be rendered depending on the
currently selected tab

Provide a className that is applied to the root <nav> component for the
<Tabs>

hidden.description: Specify whether the Tab content is hidden

role.description:
By default, this value is "navigation". You can also provide an alternate
role if it makes sense from the accessibility-side

onClick.description:
Optionally provide an `onClick` handler that is invoked when a <Tab> is
clicked

onKeyDown.description:
Optionally provide an `onKeyDown` handler that is invoked when keyed
navigation is triggered

triggerHref.description: Provide a string that represents the `href` for the triggered <Tab>

selected.description: Optionally provide an index for the currently selected <Tab>

iconDescription.description:
Provide a description that is read out when a user visits the caret icon
for the dropdown menu of items

tabContentClassName.description: Provide a className that is applied to the <TabContent> components

components in an app.
